null.verse 38:44: (En Wij zeiden:) "Neem een handvol gedroogde stengels in uw hand en sla er mee, en breek uw eed niet." Wij vonden hem standvastig. Hij was een voortreffelijke dienaar en altijd tot Ons geneigd.
null.verse 38:45: En gedenk Onze dienaren Abraham, Izaak en Jacob, de bezitters van macht en inzicht.
null.verse 38:46: Wij verkozen hen in het bijzonder - ter vormaning betreffende het laatste tehuis.
null.verse 38:47: En waarlijk, zij zijn in Onze ogen de uitverkorenen en de goeden.
null.verse 38:48: En gedenk Ismaël, Eliza en Zolkifl; zij behoren allen tot de besten.
null.verse 38:49: Dit is een aanmaning. En voor de godvruchtigen zal zeker een voortreffelijke toevlucht zijn.
null.verse 38:50: Tuinen der eeuwigheid met de poorten wijd voor hen open;
null.verse 38:51: Op tronen rustend zullen zij daarin om overvloedig vruchten en drank roepen.
null.verse 38:52: En bij hen zullen vrouwen zijn, die haar blikken weerhouden, metgezellen van gelijke leeftijd.
null.verse 38:53: Dit is hetgeen u beloofd is voor de Dag des Oordeels.
null.verse 38:54: Voorwaar dit is Onze voorziening die nooit uitgeput zal zijn.
null.verse 38:55: Dit is (voor de gelovigen). Maar voor de opstandigen zal er een slechte plaats van terugkeer zijn.
null.verse 38:56: De hel! daarin zullen zij branden, het is een slechte rustplaats,
null.verse 38:57: Deze! Laat hen daarom een kokende en een ijskoude drank proeven.
null.verse 38:58: En meer dergelijke van verschillende soorten.
null.verse 38:59: Hier is een groep van uw volgelingen die er samen met u ingestort zal worden. (Zij zullen zeggen:) "Geen welkom voor hen, zij moeten in het Vuur branden."
null.verse 38:60: Zij zullen antwoorden: "Wee, gij zijt het, voor wie geen welkom is. Gij hebt dit voor ons bereid. En het is een slechte plaats!"
null.verse 38:61: Zij zullen zeggen: "Onze Heer, wie dit voor ons bereid heeft, voeg hem een dubbele straf in het Vuur toe."
null.verse 38:62: En zij zullen zeggen: "Hoe komt het dat wij de mensen die wij onder de bozen rekenden, niet meer zien?"
null.verse 38:63: "Hebben wij hen ten onrechte bespot of zien onze ogen hen niet?"
null.verse 38:64: Voorzeker, het onderlinge redetwisten van de mensen in het Vuur is de waarheid.
null.verse 38:65: Zeg: "Ik ben slechts een waarschuwer; en er is geen God naast God, de Ene, de Onweerstaanbare;
null.verse 38:66: De Heer van de hemelen en de aarde, en alles wat er tussen is, de Machtige, de Vergevensgezinde.
null.verse 38:67: Zeg: "Het is een belangrijke mededeling,
null.verse 38:68: Doch gij wendt u er van af.
null.verse 38:69: Ik heb geen kennis van de verheven vergadering toen zij onderling redetwistten,
null.verse 38:70: Slechts dit is aan mij geopenbaard dat ik een duidelijke waarschuwer ben."
null.verse 38:71: Toen uw Heer tot de engelen zeide: "Ik ga de mens uit klei scheppen,
null.verse 38:72: En wanneer Ik hem heb gevormd en hem van Mijn geest heb ingeademd, werpt u dan in gehoorzaamheid voor hem neder.
null.verse 38:73: Derhalve vielen alle engelen neder,
null.verse 38:74: Doch Iblies niet, hij toonde hoogmoed en behoorde tot de ongelovigen.
null.verse 38:75: God zeide: "O Iblies, wat heeft u verhinderd te buigen voor hem, die Ik met Mijn Hand heb geschapen? Zijt gij te trots of behoort gij tot de (hoog) verhevenen?"
null.verse 38:76: Hij zeide: "Ik ben beter dan hij, Gij hebt mij uit vuur en hem uit klei geschapen."
null.verse 38:77: God zeide: "Ga dan hier vandaan, voorzeker gij zijt de verworpene.
null.verse 38:78: En Mijn vloek zal op u rusten tot de Dag des Oordeels."
null.verse 38:79: Hij zeide: "O mijn Heer, vergun mij dan uitstel tot de Dag waarop zij zullen worden opgewekt."
null.verse 38:81: Tot de Dag van de bepaalde tijd."
null.verse 38:82: Hij zeide: "Bij Uw eer, ik zal hen allen zeker doen dwalen,
null.verse 38:83: Behalve Uw oprechte dienaren."
null.verse 38:84: God zeide: "Dit is de waarheid en Ik zeg de waarheid,
null.verse 38:85: Dat Ik de hel zeker met u en allen die u volgen, zal vullen."
null.verse 38:86: Zeg: "Ik vraag u er geen loon voor, noch breng ik u in moeilijkheden.
null.verse 38:87: Dit is slechts een vermaning voor de werelden.
null.verse 38:88: En na een wijle zult gij de tijding er van te weten komen."

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:2: Nay, but those who disbelieve are in false pride and schism.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:3: How many a generation We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was no longer the time for escape!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:4: And they marvel that a warner from among themselves hath come unto them, and the disbelievers say: This is a wizard, a charlatan.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:5: Maketh he the gods One God ? Lo! that is an astounding thing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:6: The chiefs among them go about, exhorting: Go and be staunch to your gods! Lo! this is a thing designed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:7: We have not heard of this in later religion. This is naught but an invention.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:8: Hath the reminder been unto him (alone) among us ? Nay, but they are in doubt concerning My reminder; nay but they have not yet tasted My doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:9: Or are theirs the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Bestower ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:10: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them theirs ? Then let them ascend by ropes!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:11: A defeated host are (all) the factions that are there.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:12: The folk of Noah before them denied (their messenger) and (so did the tribe of) A’ad, and Pharaoh firmly planted,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:13: And (the tribe of) Thamud, and the folk of Lot, and the dwellers in the wood: these were the factions.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:14: Not one of them but did deny the messengers, therefor My doom was justified,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:15: These wait for but one Shout, there will be no second thereto.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:16: They say: Our Lord! Hasten on for us our fate before the Day of Reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:17: Bear with what they say, and remember Our bondman David, lord of might, Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:18: Lo! We subdued the hills to hymn the praises (of their Lord) with him at nightfall and sunrise,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:19: And the birds assembled; all were turning unto Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:20: We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:21: And hath the story of the litigants come unto thee ? How they climbed the wall into the royal chamber;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:22: How they burst in upon David, and he was afraid of them. They said: Be not afraid! (We are) two litigants, one of whom hath wronged the other, therefor judge aright between us; be not unjust; and show us the fair way.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:23: Lo! this my brother hath ninety and nine ewes while I had one ewe; and he said: Entrust it to me, and he conquered me in speech.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:24: (David) said: He hath wronged thee in demanding thine ewe in addition to his ewes, and lo! many partners oppress one another, save such as believe and do good works, and they are few. And David guessed that We had tried him, and he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he bowed himself and fell down prostrate and repented.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:25: So We forgave him that; and lo! he had access to Our presence and a happy journey’s end.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:26: (And it was said unto him): O David! Lo! We have set thee as a viceroy in the earth; therefor judge aright between mankind, and follow not desire that it beguile thee from the way of Allah. Lo! those who wander from the way of Allah have an awful doom, forasmuch as they forgot the Day of Reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:27: And We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the opinion of those who disbelieve. And woe unto those who disbelieve, from the Fire!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:28: Shall We treat those who believe and do good works as those who spread corruption in the earth; or shall We treat the pious as the wicked ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:29: (This is) a Scripture that We have revealed unto thee, full of blessing, that they may ponder its revelations, and that men of understanding may reflect.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:30: And We bestowed on David, Solomon. How excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:31: When there were shown to him at eventide lightfooted coursers
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:32: And he said: Lo! I have preferred the good things (of the world) to the remembrance of my Lord; till they were taken out of sight behind the curtain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:33: (Then he said): Bring them back to me, and fell to slashing (with his sword their) legs and necks.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:34: And verily We tried Solomon, and set upon his throne a (mere) body. Then did he repent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:35: He said: My Lord! Forgive me and bestow on me sovereignty such as shall not belong to any after me. Lo! Thou art the Bestower.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:36: So We made the wind subservient unto him, setting fair by his command whithersoever he intended.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:37: And the unruly, every builder and diver (made We subservient),
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:38: And others linked together in chains,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:39: (Saying): This is Our gift, so bestow thou, or withhold, without reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:40: And lo! he hath favour with Us, and a happy journey’s end.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:41: And make mention (O Muhammad) of Our bondman Job, when he cried unto his Lord (saying): Lo! the devil doth afflict me with distress and torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:42: (And it was said unto him): Strike the ground with thy foot. This (spring) is a cool bath and a refreshing drink.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:43: And We bestowed on him (again) his household and therewith the like thereof, a mercy from Us, and a memorial for men of understanding.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:44: And (it was said unto him): Take in thine hand a branch and smite therewith, and break not thine oath. Lo! We found him steadfast, how excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (to his Lord).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:45: And make mention of Our bondmen, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of parts and vision.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:46: Lo! We purified them with a pure thought, remembrance of the Home (of the Hereafter).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:47: Lo! in Our sight they are verily of the elect, the excellent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:48: And make mention of Ishmael and Elisha and Dhu’l-Kifl. All are of the chosen.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:49: This is a reminder. And lo! for those who ward off (evil) is a happy journey’s end,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:50: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are opened for them,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:51: Wherein, reclining, they call for plenteous fruit and cool drink (that is) therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:52: And with them are those of modest gaze, companions.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:53: This it is that ye are promised for the Day of Reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:54: Lo! this in truth is Our provision, which will never waste away.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:55: This (is for the righteous). And lo! for the transgressors there with be an evil journey’s end,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:56: Hell, where they will burn, an evil resting-place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:57: Here is a boiling and an ice-cold draught, so let them taste it,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:58: And other (torment) of the kind in pairs (the two extremes)!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:59: Here is an army rushing blindly with you. (Those who are already in the Fire say): No word of welcome for them. Lo! they will roast at the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:60: They say: Nay, but you (misleaders), for you there is no word of welcome. Ye prepared this for us (by your misleading). Now hapless is the plight.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:61: They say: Our Lord! Whoever did prepare this for us, oh, give him double portion of the Fire!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:62: And they say: What aileth us that we behold not men whom we were wont to count among the wicked ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:63: Did we take them (wrongly) for a laughing-stock, or have our eyes missed them ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:64: Lo! that is very truth: the wrangling of the dwellers in the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:65: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I am only a warner, and there is no God save Allah, the One, the Absolute,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:66: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the Pardoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:69: I had no knowledge of the Highest Chiefs when they disputed;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:70: It is revealed unto me only that I may be a plain warner.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:71: When thy Lord said unto the angels: Lo! I am about to create a mortal out of mire,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:72: And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My Spirit, then fall down before him prostrate,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:73: The angels fell down prostrate, every one,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:74: Saving Iblis; he was scornful and became one of the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:75: He said: O Iblis! What hindereth thee from falling prostrate before that which I have created with both My hands ? Art thou too proud or art thou of the high exalted ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:76: He said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire, whilst him Thou didst create of clay.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:77: He said: Go forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:78: And lo! My curse is on thee till the Day of Judgment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:79: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:80: He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:81: Until the day of the time appointed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:82: He said: Then, by Thy might, I surely will beguile them every one,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:83: Save Thy single-minded slaves among them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:84: He said: The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:85: That I shall fill hell with thee and with such of them as follow thee, together.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:86: Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you no fee for this, and I am no simulating.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:87: Lo! it is naught else than a reminder for all peoples
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 38:88: And ye will come in time to know the truth thereof.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:1: Sad: By the Qur’an, Full of Admonition: (This is the Truth).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:2: But the Unbelievers (are steeped) in self-glory and Separatism.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:3: How many generations before them did We destroy? In the end they cried (for mercy)- when there was no longer time for being saved!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:4: So they wonder that a Warner has come to them from among themselves! and the Unbelievers say, "This is a sorcerer telling lies!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:5: "Has he made the gods (all) into one God? Truly this is a wonderful thing!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:6: And the leader among them go away (impatiently), (saying), "Walk ye away, and remain constant to your gods! For this is truly a thing designed (against you)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:7: "We never heard (the like) of this among the people of these latter days: this is nothing but a made-up tale!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:8: "What! has the Message been sent to him - (Of all persons) among us?"...but they are in doubt concerning My (Own) Message! Nay, they have not yet tasted My Punishment!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:9: Or have they the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord,- the Exalted in Power, the Grantor of Bounties without measure?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:10: Or have they the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all between? If so, let them mount up with the ropes and means (to reach that end)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:11: But there - will be put to flight even a host of confederates.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:12: Before them (were many who) rejected apostles,- the people of Noah, and ’Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:13: And Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the Companions of the Wood; - such were the Confederates.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:14: Not one (of them) but rejected the apostles, but My punishment came justly and inevitably (on them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:15: These (today) only wait for a single mighty Blast, which (when it comes) will brook no delay.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:16: They say: "Our Lord! hasten to us our sentence (even) before the Day of Account!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:17: Have patience at what they say, and remember our servant David, the man of strength: for he ever turned (to God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:18: It was We that made the hills declare, in unison with him, Our Praises, at eventide and at break of day,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:19: And the birds gathered (in assemblies): all with him did turn (to God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:20: We strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and sound judgment in speech and decision.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:21: Has the Story of the Disputants reached thee? Behold, they climbed over the wall of the private chamber;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:22: When they entered the presence of David, and he was terrified of them, they said: "Fear not: we are two disputants, one of whom has wronged the other: Decide now between us with truth, and treat us not with injustice, but guide us to the even Path..
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:23: "This man is my brother: He has nine and ninety ewes, and I have (but) one: Yet he says, ’commit her to my care,’ and is (moreover) harsh to me in speech."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:24: (David) said: "He has undoubtedly wronged thee in demanding thy (single) ewe to be added to his (flock of) ewes: truly many are the partners (in business) who wrong each other: Not so do those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, and how few are they?"...and David gathered that We had tried him: he asked forgiveness of his Lord, fell down, bowing (in prostration), and turned (to God in repentance).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:25: So We forgave him this (lapse): he enjoyed, indeed, a Near Approach to Us, and a beautiful place of (Final) Return.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:26: O David! We did indeed make thee a vicegerent on earth: so judge thou between men in truth (and justice): Nor follow thou the lusts (of thy heart), for they will mislead thee from the Path of God: for those who wander astray from the Path of God, is a Penalty Grievous, for that they forget the Day of Account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:27: Not without purpose did We create heaven and earth and all between! that were the thought of Unbelievers! but woe to the Unbelievers because of the Fire (of Hell)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:28: Shall We treat those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, the same as those who do mischief on earth? Shall We treat those who guard against evil, the same as those who turn aside from the right?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:29: (Here is) a Book which We have sent down unto thee, full of blessings, that they may mediate on its Signs, and that men of understanding may receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:30: To David We gave Solomon (for a son),- How excellent in Our service! Ever did he turn (to Us)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:31: Behold, there were brought before him, at eventide coursers of the highest breeding, and swift of foot;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:32: And he said, "Truly do I love the love of good, with a view to the glory of my Lord,"- until (the sun) was hidden in the veil (of night):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:33: "Bring them back to me." then began he to pass his hand over (their) legs and their necks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:34: And We did try Solomon: We placed on his throne a body (without life); but he did turn (to Us in true devotion):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:35: He said, "O my Lord! Forgive me, and grant me a kingdom which, (it may be), suits not another after me: for Thou art the Grantor of Bounties (without measure).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:36: Then We subjected the wind to his power, to flow gently to his order, Whithersoever he willed,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:37: As also the evil ones, (including) every kind of builder and diver,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:38: As also others bound together in fetters.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:39: "Such are Our Bounties: whether thou bestow them (on others) or withhold them, no account will be asked."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:40: And he enjoyed, indeed, a Near Approach to Us, and a beautiful Place of (Final) Return.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:41: Commemorate Our Servant Job. Behold he cried to his Lord: "The Evil One has afflicted me with distress and suffering!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:42: (The command was given:) "Strike with thy foot: here is (water) wherein to wash, cool and refreshing, and (water) to drink."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:43: And We gave him (back) his people, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who have Understanding.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:44: "And take in thy hand a little grass, and strike therewith: and break not (thy oath)." Truly We found him full of patience and constancy. How excellent in Our service! ever did he turn (to Us)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:45: And commemorate Our Servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, possessors of Power and Vision.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:46: Verily We did choose them for a special (purpose)- proclaiming the Message of the Hereafter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:47: They were, in Our sight, truly, of the company of the Elect and the Good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:48: And commemorate Isma’il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:49: This is a Message (of admonition): and verily, for the righteous, is a beautiful Place of (Final) Return,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:50: Gardens of Eternity, whose doors will (ever) be open to them;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:51: Therein will they recline (at ease): Therein can they call (at pleasure) for fruit in abundance, and (delicious) drink;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:52: And beside them will be chaste women restraining their glances, (companions) of equal age.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:53: Such is the Promise made, to you for the Day of Account!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:54: Truly such will be Our Bounty (to you); it will never fail;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:55: Yea, such! but - for the wrong-doers will be an evil place of (Final) Return!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:56: Hell!- they will burn therein, - an evil bed (indeed, to lie on)!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:57: Yea, such! - then shall they taste it,- a boiling fluid, and a fluid dark, murky, intensely cold!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:58: And other Penalties of a similar kind, to match them!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:59: Here is a troop rushing headlong with you! No welcome for them! truly, they shall burn in the Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:60: (The followers shall cry to the misleaders:) "Nay, ye (too)! No welcome for you! It is ye who have brought this upon us! Now evil is (this) place to stay in!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:61: They will say: "Our Lord! whoever brought this upon us,- Add to him a double Penalty in the Fire!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:62: And they will say: "What has happened to us that we see not men whom we used to number among the bad ones?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:63: "Did we treat them (as such) in ridicule, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:64: Truly that is just and fitting,- the mutual recriminations of the People of the Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:65: Say: "Truly am I a Warner: no god is there but the one God, Supreme and Irresistible,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:66: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- Exalted in Might, able to enforce His Will, forgiving again and again."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:67: Say: "That is a Message Supreme (above all),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:69: "No knowledge have I of the Chiefs on high, when they discuss (matters) among themselves.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:70: ’Only this has been revealed to me: that I am to give warning plainly and publicly."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:71: Behold, thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:72: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:73: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:74: Not so Iblis: he was haughty, and became one of those who reject Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:75: (God) said: "O Iblis! What prevents thee from prostrating thyself to one whom I have created with my hands? Art thou haughty? Or art thou one of the high (and mighty) ones?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:76: (Iblis) said: "I am better than he: thou createdst me from fire, and him thou createdst from clay."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:77: (God) said: "Then get thee out from here: for thou art rejected, accursed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:78: "And My curse shall be on thee till the Day of Judgment."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:79: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:81: "Till the Day of the Time Appointed."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:82: (Iblis) said: "Then, by Thy power, I will put them all in the wrong,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:83: "Except Thy Servants amongst them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:84: (God) said: "Then it is just and fitting- and I say what is just and fitting-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:85: "That I will certainly fill Hell with thee and those that follow thee,- every one."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:86: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this (Qur’an), nor am I a pretender.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:87: "This is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 38:88: "And ye shall certainly know the truth of it (all) after a while."

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:1: Sad. By the Koran, containing the Remembrance --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:2: nay, but the unbelievers glory in their schism.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:3: How many a generation We destroyed before them, and they called, but time was none to escape.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:4: Now they marvel that a warner has come to them from among them; and the unbelievers say, ’This is a lying sorcerer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:5: What, has he made the gods One God? This is indeed a marvellous thing.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:6: And the Council of them depart, saying ’Go! Be steadfast to your gods; this is a thing to be desired.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:7: We have not heard of this in the last religion; this is surely an invention.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:8: What, has the Remembrance been sent down on him out of us all?’ Nay, but they are in doubt of My Remembrance; nay, they have not yet tasted My chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:9: Or have they the treasuries of thy Lord’s mercy, the All-mighty, the All-giving?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:10: Or is theirs the kingdom of the heavens and earth and of what between them is? Why, then let them ascend the cords!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:11: A very host of parties is routed there!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:12: Cried lies before them the people of Noah, and Ad, and Pharaoh, he of the tent-pegs,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:13: and Thamood, and the people of Lot, and the men of the Thicket - those were the parties;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:14: not one, that cried not lies to the Messengers, so My retribution was just.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:15: These are only awaiting for a single Cry, to which there is no delay.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:16: They say, ’Our Lord, hasten to us our share before the Day of Reckoning.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:17: Bear patiently what they say, and remember Our servant David, the man of might; he was a penitent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:18: With him We subjected the mountains to give glory at evening and sunrise,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:19: and the birds, duly mustered, every one to him reverting;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:20: We strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and speech decisive.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:21: Has the tiding of the dispute come to thee? When they scaled the Sanctuary,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:22: when they entered upon David, and he took fright at them; and they said, ’Fear not; two disputants we are -- one of us has injured the other; so judge between us justly, and transgress not, and guide us to the right path.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:23: ’Behold, this my brother has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe. So he said, "Give her into my charge"; and he overcame me in the argument.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:24: Said he, ’Assuredly he has wronged thee in asking for thy ewe in addition to his sheep; and indeed many intermixers do injury one against the other, save those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- and how few they are!’ And David thought that We had only tried him; therefore he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down, bowing, and he repented.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:25: Accordingly We forgave him that, and he has a near place in Our presence and a fair resort.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:26: ’David, behold, We have appointed thee a viceroy in the earth; therefore judge between men justly, and follow not caprice, lest it lead thee astray from the way of God. Surely those who go astray from the way of God -- there awaits them a terrible chastisement, for that they have forgotten the Day of Reckoning.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:27: We have not created the heavens and earth, and what between them is, for vanity; such is the thought of the unbelievers, wherefore woe unto the unbelievers because of the Fire!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:28: Or shall We make those who believe and do righteous deeds as the workers of corruption in the earth, or shall We make the godfearing as the transgressors?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:29: A Book We have sent down to thee, Blessed, that men possessed of minds may ponder its signs and so remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:30: And We gave unto David Solomon; how excellent a servant he was! He was a penitent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:31: When in the evening were presented to him the standing steeds,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:32: he said, ’Lo, I have loved the love of good things better than the remembrance of my Lord, until the sun was bidden behind the veil.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:33: Return them to me!’ And he began to stroke their shanks and necks.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:34: Certainly We tried Solomon, and We cast upon his throne a mere body; then he repented.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:35: He said, ’My Lord, forgive me, and give me a kingdom such as may not befall anyone after me; surely Thou art the All-giver.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:36: So We subjected to him the wind, that ran at his commandment, softly, wherever he might light on,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:37: and the Satans, every builder and diver
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:38: and others also, coupled in fetters:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:39: ’This is Our gift; bestow or withhold without reckoning.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:40: And he had a near place in Our presence and a fair resort.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:41: Remember also Our servant Job; when he called to his Lord, ’Behold, Satan has visited me with weariness and chastisement.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:42: ’Stamp thy foot! This is a laving-place cool, and a drink.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:43: And We gave to him his family, and the like of them with them, as a mercy from us, and a reminder unto men possessed of minds;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:44: and, ’Take in thy hand a bundle of rushes, and strike therewith, and do not fail in thy oath.’ Surely We found him a steadfast man. How excellent a servant he was! He was a penitent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:45: Remember also Our servants Abraham, Isaac and Jacob -- men of might they and of vision.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:46: Assuredly We purified them with a quality most pure, the remembrance of the Abode,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:47: and in Our sight they are of the chosen, the excellent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:48: Remember also Our servants Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhul Kifl; each is among the excellent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:49: This is a Remembrance; and for the godfearing is a fair resort,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:50: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are open to them,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:51: wherein they recline, and wherein they call for fruits abundant, and sweet potions,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:52: and with them maidens restraining their glances of equal age.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:53: ’This is what you were promised for the Day of Reckoning;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:54: this is Our provision, unto which there is no end.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:55: All this; but for the insolent awaits an ill resort,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:56: Gehenna, wherein they are roasted - an evil cradling!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:57: All this; so let them taste it - boiling water and pus,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:58: and other torments of the like kind coupled together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:59: ’This is a troop rushing in with you; there is no Welcome for them; they shall roast in the Fire.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:60: They say, ’No, it is you have no Welcome; you forwarded it for us; how evil a stablishment!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:61: They say, ’Our Lord, whoso forwarded this for us, give him a double chastisement in the Fire!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:62: They say, ’How is it with us, that we do not see men here that we counted among the wicked?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:63: What, did we take them for a laughing-stock? Or have our eyes swerved away from them?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:64: Surely that is true -- the disputing of the inhabitants of the Fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:65: Say: ’I am only a warner. There is not any god but God, the One, the Omnipotent,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:66: Lord of the heavens and earth, and of what between them is, the All-mighty, the All-forgiving.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:68: from which you are turning away.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:69: I had no knowledge of the High Council when they disputed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:70: This alone is revealed to me, that I am only a clear warner.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:71: When thy Lord said to the angels, ’See, I am creating a mortal of a clay.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:72: When I have shaped him, and breathed My spirit in him, fall you down, bowing before him!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:73: Then the angels bowed themselves all together,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:74: save Iblis; he waxed proud, and was one of the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:75: Said He, ’Iblis, what prevented thee to bow thyself before that I created with My own hands? Hast thou waxed proud, or art thou of the lofty ones?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:76: Said he, ’I am better than he; Thou createdst me of tire, and him Thou createdst of clay.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:77: Said He, ’Then go thou forth hence; thou art accursed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:78: Upon thee shall rest My curse, till the Day of Doom.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:79: Said he, ’My Lord, respite me till the day they shall be raised.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:80: Said He, ’Thou art among the ones that are respited
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:81: until the day of the known time.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:82: Said he, ’Now, by Thy glory, I shall pervert them all together,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:83: excepting those Thy servants among them that are sincere.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:84: Said He, ’This is the truth, and the truth I say;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:85: I shall assuredly fill Gehenna with thee, and with whosoever of them follows thee, all together.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:86: Say: ’I ask of you no wage for it, neither am I of those who take things upon themselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:87: It is nothing but a reminder unto all beings,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 38:88: and you shall surely know its tiding after a while.’

Muhammad Asad.verse 38:1: Sād. CONSIDER this Qur’ān, endowed with all that one ought to remember!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:2: But nay – they who are bent on denying the truth are lost in [false] pride, and [hence] deeply in the wrong.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:3: How many a generation have We destroyed before their time [for this very sin]! And [how] they called [unto Us] when it was too late to escape!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:4: Now these [people] deem it strange that a warner should have come unto them from their own midst – and [so] the deniers of the truth are saying: "A [mere] spellbinder is he, a liar!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:5: Does he claim that all the deities are [but] one God? Verily, a most strange thing is this!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:6: And their leaders launch forth [thus]: "Go ahead, and hold steadfastly onto your deities: this, behold, is the only thing to do!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:7: Never did we hear of [a claim like] this in any faith of latter days! It is nothing but [a mortal man’s] invention!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:8: What! Upon him alone from among all of us should a [divine] reminder have been bestowed from on high?" Nay, but it is My Own reminder that they distrust! Nay, they have not yet tasted the suffering which I do impose!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:9: Or do they [think that they] own the treasures of thy Sustainer’s grace – [the grace] of the Almighty, the Giver of Gifts?
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:10: Or [that] the dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them is theirs? Why, then, let them try to ascend [to God-like power] by all [conceivable] means!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:11: [But] there it is: any and all human beings, however [strongly] leagued together, are bound to suffer defeat [whenever they refuse to accept the truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:12: To the truth gave the lie aforetime Noah’s people, and [the tribe of] ’ād, and Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:13: and [the tribe of] Thamūd, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan]: they all were leagued together, [as it were, in their unbelief:]
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:14: not one [was there] but gave the lie to the apostles – and thereupon My retribution fell due.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:15: And they [who now deny the truth – they, too,] have but to wait for one single blast [of punishment to overtake them]: it shall not be delayed a whit.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:16: As it is, they say [mockingly]: "O our Sustainer! Hasten on to us our share [of punishment even] before the Day of Reckoning!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:17: [But] bear thou with patience whatever they may say, and remember Our servant David, him who was endowed with [so much] inner strength! He, verily, would always turn unto Us:
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:18: [and for this,] behold, We caused the mountains to join him in extolling Our limitless glory at eventide and at sunrise,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:19: and [likewise] the birds in their assemblies: [together] they all would turn again and again unto Him [who had created them].
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:20: And We strengthened his dominion, and bestowed upon him wisdom and sagacity in judgment.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:21: AND YET, has the story of the litigants come within thy ken – [the story of the two] who surmounted the walls of the sanctuary [in which David prayed]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:22: As they came upon David, and he shrank back in fear from them, they said: "Fear not! [We are but] two litigants. One of us has wronged the other: so judge thou between us with justice, and deviate not from what is right, and show [both of] us the way to rectitude.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:23: "Behold, this is my brother: he has ninety-nine ewes, whereas I have [only] one ewe – and yet he said, ‘Make her over to me,’ and forcibly prevailed against me in this [our] dispute."
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:24: Said [David]: "He has certainly wronged thee by demanding that thy ewe be added to his ewes! Thus, behold, do many kinsmen wrong one another – [all] save those who believe [in God] and do righteous deeds: but how few are they!" And [suddenly] David understood that We had tried him: and so he asked his Sustainer to forgive him his sin, and fell down in prostration, and turned unto Him in repentance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:25: And thereupon We forgave him that [sin]: and, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:26: [And We said:] "O David! Behold, We have made thee a [prophet and, thus, Our] vicegerent on earth: judge, then, between men with justice, and do not follow vain desire, lest it lead thee astray from the path of God: verily, for those who go astray from the path of God there is suffering severe in store for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:27: AND [thus it is:] We have not created heaven and earth and all that is between them without meaning and purpose, as is the surmise of those who are bent on denying the truth: but then, woe from the fire [of hell] unto all who are bent on denying the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:28: [For] would We treat those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds in the same manner as [We shall treat] those who spread corruption on earth? Would We treat the God-conscious in the same manner as the wicked?
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:29: [All this have We expounded in this] blessed divine writ which We have revealed unto thee, [O Muhammad,] so that men may ponder over its messages, and that those who are endowed with insight may take them to heart.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:30: AND UNTO DAVID We granted Solomon [as a son – and] how excellent a servant [of Ours he grew up to be]! Behold, he would always turn unto Us –
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:31: [and even] when, towards the close of day, nobly-bred, swift-footed steeds were brought before him,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:32: he would say, "Verily, I have come to love the love of all that is good because I bear my Sustainer in mind!" – [repeating these words as the steeds raced away,] until they were hidden by the veil [of distance – whereupon he would command],
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:33: "Bring them back unto me!" – and would [lovingly] stroke their legs and their necks.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:34: But [ere this], indeed, We had tried Solomon by placing upon his throne a [lifeless] body; and thereupon he turned [towards Us; and]
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:35: he prayed: "O my Sustainer! Forgive me my sins, and bestow upon me the gift of a kingdom which may not suit anyone after me: verily, Thou alone art a giver of gifts!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:36: And so We made subservient to him the wind, so that it gently sped at his behest whithersoever he willed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:37: as well as all the rebellious forces [that We made to work for him] – every kind of builder and diver –
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:38: and others linked together in fetters.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:39: [And We told him:] "This is Our gift, for thee to bestow freely on others, or to withhold, without [having to render] account!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:40: And, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:41: AND CALL to mind Our servant Job, [how it was] when he cried out to his Sustainer, "Behold, Satan has afflicted me with [utter] weariness and suffering!" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:42: [and thereupon was told:] "Strike [the ground] with thy foot: here is cool water to wash with and to drink!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:43: And We bestowed upon him new offspring, doubling their number as an act of grace from Us, and as a reminder unto all who are endowed with insight.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:44: [And finally We told him:] "Now take in thy hand a small bunch of grass, and strike therewith, and thou wilt not break thine oath!" – for, verily, We found him full of patience in adversity: how excellent a servant [of Ours], who, behold, would always turn unto Us!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:45: AND CALL to mind Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, [all of them] endowed with inner strength and vision:
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:46: for, verily, We purified them by means of a thought most pure: the remembrance of the life to come.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:47: And, behold, in Our sight they were indeed among the elect, the truly good!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:48: And call to mind Ishmael and Elisha, and every one who [like them] has pledged himself [unto Us]: for each of them was of the truly good!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:49: LET [all] this be a reminder [to those who believe in God] – for, verily, the most beauteous of all goals awaits the God-conscious:
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:50: gardens of perpetual bliss, with gates wide-open to them,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:51: wherein they will recline, [and] wherein they may [freely] call for many a fruit and drink,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:52: having beside them well-matched mates of modest gaze.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:53: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning:
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:54: this, verily, shall be Our provision [for you], with no end to it!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:55: All this [for the righteous]: but, verily, the most evil of all goals awaits those who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right:
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:56: hell will they have to endure – and how vile a resting-place!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:57: This, [then, for them –] so let them taste it: burning despair and ice-cold darkness
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:58: and, coupled with it, further [suffering] of a similar nature.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:59: [And they will say to one another: "Do you see] this crowd of people who rushed headlong [into sin] with you? No welcome to them! Verily, they [too] shall have to endure the fire!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:60: [And] they [who had been seduced] will exclaim: "Nay, but it is you! No welcome to you! It is you who have prepared this for us: and how vile a state to abide in!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:61: [And] they will pray: "O our Sustainer! Whoever has prepared this for us, double Thou his suffering in the fire!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:62: And they will add: "How is it that we do not see [here any of the] men whom we were wont to count among the wicked,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:63: [and] whom we made the target of our derision? Or is it that [they are here, and] our eyes have missed them?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:64: Such, behold, will in truth be the [confusion and] mutual wrangling of the people of the fire!
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:65: SAY [O Muhammad]: "I am only a warner; and there is no deity whatever save God, the One, who holds absolute sway over all that exists,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:66: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Almighty, the All-Forgiving!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:68: [how can] you turn away from it?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:69: [Say, O Muhammad:] "No knowledge would I have had of [what passed among] the host on high when they argued [against the creation of man],
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:70: had it not been revealed unto me [by God] – to no other end than that l might convey [unto you] a plain warning."
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:71: [For,] lo, thy Sustainer said unto the angels: "Behold, I am about to create a human being out of clay;
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:72: and when I have formed him fully and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down before him in prostration!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:73: Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:74: save Iblīs: he gloried in his arrogance, and [thus] became one of those who deny the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:75: Said He: "O Iblīs! What has kept thee from prostrating thyself before that [being] which I have created with My hands? Art thou too proud [to bow down before another created being], or art thou of those who think [only] of themselves as high?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:76: Answered [Iblīs]: "I am better than he: Thou hast created me out of fire, whereas him Thou hast created out of clay."
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:77: Said He: "Go forth, then, from this [angelic state] – for, behold, thou art henceforth accursed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:78: and My rejection shall be thy due until the Day of Judgment!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:79: Said [Iblīs]: "Then, O my Sustainer, grant me a respite till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead! "
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:80: Answered He: "Verily, so [be it:] thou shalt be among those who are granted respite
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:81: till the Day the time whereof is known [only to Me]."
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:82: [Whereupon Iblīs] said: "Then [I swear] by Thy very might: I shall most certainly beguile them all into grievous error –
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:83: [all] save such of them as are truly Thy servants!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:84: [And God] said: "This, then, is the truth! And this truth do I state:
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:85: Most certainly will I fill hell with thee and such of them as shall follow thee, all together!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:86: SAY [O Prophet]: "No reward whatever do I ask of you for this [message]; and I am not one of those who claim to be what they are not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:87: This [divine writ], behold, is no less than a reminder to all the worlds –
Muhammad Asad.verse 38:88: and you will most certainly grasp its purport after a lapse of time!"

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:1: Sād . I swear by the Qur’ān, (the book) containing advice, (this is true,)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:2: but those who disbelieve are (involved) in false pride and opposition.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:3: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, so they cried out (for mercy), while no time was left for having any refuge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:4: They (the pagans) wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, “This is a magician, a sheer liar.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:5: Has he (not) turned all the gods into a single God? It is a very strange thing indeed.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:6: And the leaders among them walked out saying (to their followers), “Walk away (from the Prophet,) and stay firm on (adhering to) your gods. This (call of the Prophet) is surely something designed (for his personal benefit).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:7: We never heard of it in the classical faith (of ours). This is nothing but a false invention.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:8: Is it (believable) that the message of advice has been sent down to him (alone) from among all of us?” The fact is that they are in doubt about My message; rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:9: Do they have the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, the Mighty, the Bountiful?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:10: Or do they have the ownership of the heavens and the earth and what lies between them? Then let them ascend (to the sky) by ropes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:11: What is there (in Makkah) is just a host of the (opposing) groups that has to be defeated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:12: Even before them, the people of NūH and ‘Ād and Fir‘aun (Pharaoh), the man of stakes,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:13: and Thamūd and the people of LūT and the people of Aaikah have rejected (the messengers). They were the (strong) groups.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:14: All of them did nothing but declare the messengers as liars; hence, My punishment became due.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:15: And these people are waiting for nothing but for a single Cry (the sound of the Trumpet to be blown on Doomsday) that will have no pause.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:16: And they say, “O our Lord, give us our share (of the punishment) sooner, before the Day of Reckoning.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:17: Bear patiently with what they say, and remember Our servant Dawūd, the man of might. Surely he was ever-turning to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:18: We had subjugated the mountains to join him (in) making tasbīH (i.e. pronouncing Allah’s purity) at evening and sunrise,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:19: and the birds as well, mustered together. All were turning to Allah with him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:20: And We made his kingdom strong, and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:21: Has there come to you the story of the litigants, when they entered the sanctuary by climbing over the wall?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:22: When they entered upon Dawūd, and he was scared of them, they said, “Be not scared. We are two litigants; one of us has wronged the other, so decide between us with truth, and do not cross the limits, and guide us to the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:23: This is my brother; he has ninety nine ewes, and I have a single ewe; still he said, ‘Give it into my charge.’ And he overpowered me in speech.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:24: He (Dawūd) said, “He has certainly wronged you by demanding your ewe to be added to his ewe. Many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds, and very few they are.” And Dawūd realized that We had put him to a test, so he prayed to his Lord for forgiveness, and bowing down, he fell in prostration, and turned (to Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:25: So we forgave him that (lapse), and surely he has a place of nearness in Our presence, and an excellent resort.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:26: O Dawūd, We have made you a vicegerent on earth, so judge between people with truth, and do not follow the selfish desire, lest it should lead you astray from Allah’s path. Surely those who go astray from Allah’s path will have a severe punishment, because they had forgotten the Day of Reckoning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:27: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them in vain. That is the thinking of those who disbelieve. So, woe to the disbelievers because of the Fire (they have to face).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:28: Shall We make those who believe and do righteous deeds equal to those who commit mischief on the earth? Or shall We make the God-fearing equal to the sinners?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:29: This is a blessed Book We have revealed to you, so that they deliberate in its verses, and so that the men of understanding may heed to advice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:30: And We blessed Dawūd with Sulaimān. He was an excellent servant (of Allah). Surely, he was great in turning (to Us, in penitence and praise).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:31: (Worth remembering is the incident) when the swift horses of high breeding were presented before him in the evening.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:32: He said, “I held the love of the good things (i.e. these horses) because of the remembrance of my Lord.” until it went behind the veil.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:33: (Then he said,) “Bring them back to me” - and he started passing his hands over the shanks and the necks (of the horses).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:34: And indeed We tested Sulaimān while We threw on his throne a body after which he turned (to Us).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:35: He said, “O my Lord, forgive me, and bless me with a kingdom that will not be available to anyone after me. Surely, You are the Bountiful.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:36: Then We subjugated the wind for him that blew smoothly on his command to wherever he wished,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:37: and (We subjugated to him) the devils (among Jinns), all builders and divers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:38: and many others held in chains.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:39: This is Our gift. So, do favor (to someone) or withhold (it), with no (requirement to give) account.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:40: He has a place of nearness in Our presence, and an excellent end.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:41: And remember Our servant, Ayyūb - when he called his Lord saying, “The ShaiTān (Satan) has inflicted weariness and pain upon me.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:42: (Allah said to him,) “Strike (the ground) with your foot: Here is a cool water to bathe, and a drink!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:43: And We let him have his family and the like of them besides, as a mercy from Us, and a reminder for the people of understanding.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:44: And (We said to him,) “Take (a bundle of) thin twigs in your hand, and strike with it, and do not violate your oath. Surely, We found him very enduring. He was really an excellent servant. Surely, he was great in turning (to Us, in penitence and praise).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:45: And remember Our servants - Ibrāhīm and IsHāq and Ya‘qūb - the men of strength and the men of vision.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:46: We chose them for a trait of remembering the (eternal) Home (in the Hereafter).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:47: And surely they are, in Our sight, among the chosen, the best of the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:48: And remember Ismā‘īl and Al-Yasa‘ and Dhul-Kifl. Each one of them was among the best of the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:49: This is a reminder (of what has passed). And surely the God-fearing will have the best place to return:
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:50: - everlasting gardens, with (their) doors opened for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:51: They will be relaxing in it, calling there for plenteous fruits and drinks;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:52: and in their company there will be females restricting their glances (to their husbands, and) of matching ages.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:53: This is what you are being promised for the Day of Reckoning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:54: Surely, that is provision provided by Us, to which there is no end.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:55: Having said this, the transgressors will surely have the most evil place to return:
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:56: the Jahannam , in which they will enter. So, how evil is that place to rest?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:57: Let them taste this: hot water and pus,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:58: and other things similar to it of various kinds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:59: (When the leaders of the infidels will see their followers entering the Hell after them, they will say to each other,) “This is a multitude rushing into (the Hell) with you - they are not welcome - they are to burn in the Fire.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:60: They (the followers) will say (to their leaders) “No, it is you who are not welcome; you are the ones who brought this upon us.” So, how evil is the place to stay (for ever)!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:61: They (the followers) will say, “Our Lord, whoever has brought this on us, do increase his punishment twofold in the Fire.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:62: And they (the infidels) will say, “What is the matter with us that we do not see those men (here in Hell) whom we used to count amongst the worst? (i.e the Muslims whom the infidels used to treat as the worst people among them)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:63: Had we taken them as a laughing-stock (unjustly), or have our eyes missed them?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:64: That is going to happen definitely, that is, the mutual quarrel of the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:65: Say, “I am only a warner, and there is no god but Allah, the One, the All-Dominant,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:66: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Mighty, the Very-Forgiving.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:69: I had no knowledge of the Heavenly Beings when they were debating (about the creation of ’Ādam).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:70: Revelation is sent to me only because I am a plain warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:71: When your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create man from clay.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:72: So, once I make him perfectly and breath My spirit into him, you must fall down in prostration before him.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:73: Then, the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:74: except Iblīs (Satan). He waxed proud, and became one of the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:75: He (Allah) said, “O Iblīs, what did prevent you from prostrating yourself before what I created with My hands? Did you wax proud or were you among the lofty ones?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:76: He said, “I am better than him. You created me from fire, and created him from clay.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:77: He said, “Then, get out from here, for you are accursed,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:78: and on you shall remain My curse till the Day of Judgment.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:79: He said, “O my Lord, then give me respite till the day they are raised again.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:80: He said, “Then, you have been given respite,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:81: until the Day of the Appointed Time.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:82: He said, “Then, I swear by Your Might, that I will definitely lead them astray, all of them -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:83: except Your chosen servants among them.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:84: He (Allah) said, “Then, the truth is-and it is (always) the truth that I speak-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:85: that I will definitely fill the Jahannam with you and with those who will follow you from among them, all together.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:86: Say (O Prophet to the unbelievers,) “I do not demand from you any fee for it, nor am I from among those who make up things artificially.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:87: It is nothing but an advice for all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 38:88: And you will come to know its reality after a while.”

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:1: Sād. By the Qur’ān bearing the Remembrance,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:2: Nay, but those who disbelieve dwell in conceit and defiance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:3: How many a generation We have destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was no longer the time for escape.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:4: And they marvel that a warner has come to them from among themselves. And those who disbelieve say, ‘This is a sorcerer, a liar.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:5: Has he made the gods One God? Lo! that is indeed a curious thing’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:6: And the council from among them go about, saying, ‘Go!, and stand by your gods; lo! this is indeed a thing sought.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:7: We never heard of this in the latter-day creed. This is surely [nothing] but an invention.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:8: Has the Remembrance been revealed to him out of [all of] us’. Nay, but they are in doubt concerning My Remembrance. Nay, but they have not yet tasted My chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:9: Or do they possess the treasuries of your Lord’s mercy, the Mighty, the Bestower?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:10: Or do they possess the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them? Then let them ascend by the means.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:11: A routed host [is all that they are], nothing more from among the factions.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:12: Before them the people of Noah denied, and [so did those of] ‘ād and Pharaoh, he of the stakes
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:13: and Thamūd and the people of Lot and the dwellers in the wood — those were the factions.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:14: Each one did not but deny the messengers. So My retribution was justified.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:15: And these do not await but a single Cry for which there will be no revoking.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:16: And they said, ‘Our Lord, hasten on for us the record of our deeds before the Day of Reckoning’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:17: Bear patiently what they say and remember Our servant David, the one of fortitude. Indeed he was a penitent .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:18: Truly We disposed the mountains to glorify [God] with him at evening and at sunrise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:19: And the birds, mustered [in flocks], each turning to him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:20: And We strengthened his Kingdom, and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:21: And has there come to you the tale of the disputants, when they scaled the sanctuary?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:22: When they entered upon David, and he was frightened by them. And they said, ‘Do not fear two disputants. One of us has infringed upon the [rights of the] other, so judge justly between us and do not transgress, and guide us to the right path’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:23: ‘Behold, this brother of mine has ninety-nine ewes, while I have a single ewe; yet he said, “Entrust it to me”, and he overcame me in speech’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:24: He said, ‘He has certainly wronged you by asking for your ewe that he may add it to his sheep. And indeed many associates infringe upon [the rights of] one another, except such as believe and perform righteous deeds, but few are they!’. And David thought that We had indeed tried him. So he sought forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing and repented.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:25: So We forgave him that and indeed he has [a station of] nearness with Us and a fair return.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:26: ‘O David! We have indeed made you a vicegerent on the earth; so judge justly between people and do not follow desire that it then lead you astray from the way of God. Truly those who go astray from the way of God — for them there will be a severe chastisement because of their forgetting the Day of Reckoning’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:27: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the supposition of those who disbelieve. So woe to the disbelievers from the Fire!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:28: Or shall We treat those who believe and perform righteous deeds like those who cause corruption in the earth; or shall We treat the God-fearing like the profligate?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:29: A Book that We have revealed to you, full of blessing, that they may contemplate its signs and that they may remember those people of pith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:30: And We bestowed on David, Solomon — what an excellent servant! Truly he was a penitent .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:31: When one evening there were displayed before him the prancing steeds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:32: He said, ‘Lo! I have loved the love of [worldly] good things over the remembrance of my Lord’, until it disappeared behind the [night’s] veil.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:33: Bring them back to me! Then he set about slashing [their] legs and necks.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:34: And We certainly tried Solomon. And We cast upon his throne a [lifeless] body. Then he repented.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:35: He said, ‘My Lord! Forgive me and grant me a kingdom that shall not belong to anyone after me. Truly You are the Bestower’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:36: So We disposed for him the wind, which blew softly at his command wherever he intended.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:37: And the devils [also We disposed], every builder, and diver,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:38: and others too, bounded together in fetters.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:39: ‘This is Our gift. So bestow or withhold without any reckoning’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:40: And indeed he has [a station of] nearness with Us and a fair resort.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:41: And mention also Our servant Job, when he called out to his Lord, ‘Lo! Satan has afflicted me with hardship and suffering’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:42: ‘Stamp your foot. This is a cool bath and a drink’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:43: And We gave him [back] his family along with others like them, as a mercy from us, and a reminder to people of pith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:44: And [We said to him], ‘Take in your hand a bunch of twigs, and smite therewith, and do not break [your] oath’. Truly We found him to be steadfast. What an excellent servant! Indeed he was a penitent .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:45: And mention [also] Our servants Abraham, and Isaac and Jacob — men of fortitude and insight.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:46: Assuredly We purified them with an exclusive [thought], the remembrance of the Abode.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:47: And indeed in Our sight they are of the elect, the excellent.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:48: And mention [also] Our servants Ishmael, and Elisha, and Dhū’l-Kifl. Each was among the excellent.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:49: This is a remembrance; and indeed for the God-fearing, there will truly be a fair return —
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:50: Gardens of Eden whose gates are [flung] open for them;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:51: reclining therein; therein they call for plenteous fruit and drink.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:52: And with them [there] will be maidens of restrained glances of a like age.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:53: ‘This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:54: This is indeed Our provision, which will never be exhausted’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:55: That [is so]; but for the insolent there will surely be an evil [place of] return —
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:56: Hell, which they will enter — an evil resting place!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:57: This, let them then taste it: burning hot water, and pus,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:58: and other kinds [of torment] resembling it in pairs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:59: ‘This is a horde about to plunge with you: No welcome [is there] for them [here]! They will indeed roast in the Fire’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:60: They say, ‘Nay, but for you [there is] no welcome! You prepared this for us. So what an evil abode!’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:61: They say, ‘Our Lord, whoever prepared this for us, give him double his chastisement in the Fire!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:62: And they say: ‘What is the matter with us that we do not see [here] men whom we used to count among the wicked?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:63: Did we treat them mockingly? Or have [our] eyes missed them ?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:64: Assuredly that is true: the wrangling of the inhabitants of the Fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:65: Say: ‘I am only a warner. And there is no god except God, the One, the All-Compelling;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:66: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the [ever] Forgiving’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:68: from which you are turning away.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:69: I had no knowledge of the High Council when they disputed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:70: All that is revealed to me is that I am just a plain warner’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:71: When your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am about to create a human being out of clay.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:72: So when I have proportioned him, and breathed in him My spirit, then fall down in prostration before him!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:73: Thereat the angels prostrated, all of them together,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:74: except Iblīs; he was disdainful and he was one of the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:75: He said, ‘O Iblīs! What prevents you from prostrating before that which I have created with My own hands? Are you being arrogant, or are you of the exalted?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:76: He said, ‘I am better than him. You created me from fire and You created him from clay’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:77: He said, ‘Then begone hence, for you are indeed accursed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:78: And indeed My curse shall be on you until the Day of Judgement’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:79: He said, ‘My Lord, then reprieve me until the day when they will be raised’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:80: He said, ‘Then you will indeed be among the reprieved
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:81: until the day of the known time’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:82: He said, ‘Now, by Your might, I shall surely pervert them all,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:83: except those servants of Yours among them who will be saved’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:84: He said, ‘So the truth is — and the truth I [always] speak,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:85: I shall assuredly fill Hell with you and with whoever of them follows you, all together’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:86: Say: ‘I do not ask of you, in return for this any reward; nor am I an impostor.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:87: It is only a reminder for all worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 38:88: And you will assuredly come to know its tiding in [due] time’.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:1: Sad. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.) By the Holy Qur’an, full of direction and guidance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:2: But the disbelievers are in (the trouble of undue and unjust) conceit and arrogance, (suffering from) opposition and enmity (against Our Esteemed Prophet).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:3: How many a community We have destroyed before them! And they started crying (on seeing the torment) when there was no time left for deliverance (and release).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:4: And they wondered that a Warner had come to them from amongst themselves and the disbelievers said: ‘He is a magician, a great liar.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:5: Has he turned all the gods into one God? That is indeed a very strange thing!’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:6: And their chiefs (stood up terminating their meeting with the Holy Prophet [blessings and peace be upon him] at Abu Talib’s house) and walked out saying (to the rest of the people): ‘You also walk out, and be firm-footed in (worshipping) your gods. There is for sure some motive (and purpose) behind it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:7: We have not heard of this (belief in the Oneness of God) even amongst the last community (of Christianity or the religion of the Quraysh). This is but a fabricated lie.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:8: Has this admonition (the Qur’an) been sent down to him alone out of all of us?’ To be more precise, they are (caught) in doubt about My admonition. But in truth they have not yet tasted My torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:9: Do they have the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, Who is the Almighty, the Most Benevolent?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:10: Or do they possess the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them? (If so,) then they should tie up ropes and climb up (to heaven).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:11: They are just a worthless army of the armies (of the disbelievers) that is about to be badly defeated at this very place.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:12: Before them the people of Nuh (Noah) and ‘Ad and (also) Pharaoh, the powerful king (who tortured with stakes), belied and disbelieved;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:13: And Thamud and the people of Lut (Lot) and the dwellers of (the Wood) al-Ayka (i.e., the people of Shu‘ayb) too (denied). These were the large armies.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:14: Each (one of these) people rejected the Messengers and My torment became inevitable (for them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:15: And all of them are waiting for a single mighty blast (shout) in which there will be no deferment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 38:16: And they say: ‘O our Lord, hasten to us our share even before the Day of Reckoning.’
